info.name: /login endpoint tests [GitHub Actions]
info.description:
Collection of tests for the GAD application endpoint /login.  
GAD documentation available at:  
[https://github.com/jaktestowac/gad-gui-api-demo](https://github.com/jaktestowac/gad-gui-api-demo)

item.name: Login - positive
Receives user token using valid credentials

exec: pm.test("Response is in JSON format", function () {
pm.test("Response has the required field - access_token", function () {
//second way to check the presence of a property token:
pm.test("Data type of field - access_token is a string", function () {
pm.test("access_token is a non-empty string", function () {
//setting the exact moment of generating a new token

response.name: Receives user token using valid credentials

item.description:
Given: JSON body with registered user's email and correct password  
When: Sending a POST request to endpoint /login  
Then: Receiving a response with a token and 200 code.

item.name: Validate token - positive
The logged in user has a valid token

exec: //importing a library for date and time management
console.info("Access token is empty or expired. Getting new token...")
console.log("Token successfully generated and saved in environment variables.");

item.description:
Given: Valid bearer token in "Authorization" header  
When: Sending a GET request to endpoint /login  
Then: Receiving a response with code 200

item.name: Validate wrong token - negative
Wrong token is indicated as invalid

exec: pm.test("The error message is 'Access token is invalid!'", function () {

item.name: Request without token gives response code 404

exec: pm.test("The error message is correct", function () {

item.description:
Given: Invalid bearer token in "Authorization" header  
When: Sending a GET request to endpoint /login  
Then: Receiving a response with a 401 code and appropriate message

item.name: Failed login request with wrong method - negative
item.description:
Given: Body with registered user's email and correct password  
When: Sending a request other than POST and GET to endpoint /login  
Then: Receiving a response with 404 token.

exec: pm.test("Response does not contain any data", function () {

item.name: Failed login request with broken body - negative
JSON in header, html in body

body.raw:
This is a Heading

This is a paragraph.

item.description:
Given: Body with broken JSON  
When: Sending a POST request to endpoint /login  
Then: Receiving a response with 400 code.

exec: pm.test("The error message is correct", function () {
pm.expect(pm.response.json().error).to.equal("SyntaxError: Unexpected data in JSON. Please check Your JSON.");

item.name: Failed login with incorrect body - negative
item.description:
Given: Body with incorrect body  
When: Sending a POST request to endpoint /login  
Then: Receiving a response with 401 code and message 'Incorrect email or password'

exec: pm.test("Response is in JSON format", function () {
pm.test("Response message is 'Incorrect email or password'", function () {
